contact.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
contact.department: Department of Engineering Science and Mechanics

school.name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
school.thesis: Geometrically Nonlinear Stress Recovery in Composite Laminates

school.name: Cedarville University
school.note: Passed Fundamentals of Engineering Exam, April 2006.

job.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
The High School Affiliated with the People's University of China

position.title: Technical Customer Support Manager
position.description: Support customers in their use of SIMULIA's simulation software portforlio, primarily the Abaqus finite element anlaysis software suite, with an emphasis on modeling linear dynamics and acoustics analyses.

job.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

position.title: Research Assistant, Scott W. Case
position.description: Funded by Pratt & Whitney, East Hartford, CT. Simulated quasi-static punch experiment of graphite fiber reinforced composite laminate using progressive failure finite element analysis.

position.title: Research Assistant, Scott W. Case
position.description: Funded by Army Research Laboratories. Designed single-stage gas gun and performed experimental tests to characterize the behavior of flexible fibrous composite plates under intermediate-velocity rigid-body impact.

position.title: Systems Enginer
position.description: Modeled combined cycle gas turbine power plant mechanical systems through numerical simulation tools for use in educational training environments.

position.title: Manufacturing Engineering Intern
position.description: Evaluated use of automated optical inspection equipment for in-line inspection of circuit card assembly production.

awards.item: Jefferson Goblet Award for Best Student Paper, 52nd AIAA SDM Conference, April, 2011
NCCAA Sportsmanship Award in Men's Tennis, 2006
